page.title: 02 "INTRODUCTION"(CONT)
page.content: small copses rather than large woods, these are predominantly hardwoods (category 14) with only occasional conifers.Hedges are generally well grown and maintained,and contain some trees.Hedge pleaching (laying) is a feature of hedge management and is a highly skilled art. Annual maintenance is mechanised. Two stretches of parkland feature in the area; Meynell Langley with its ancient oak and Kedleston Hall,the stately home of Lord Scarsdale. Secondary roads serve the area, built long before the advent of milk tankers and heavy bulk transport, serving the farms.
